projects.title: WoahACPU
projects.description:
WoahACPU is a process scheduling simulator developed for the Operating Systems course, visualizing how processes are selected by different scheduling algorithms.
Features include: Unity-based simulation built with Unity 2021.3.22f1, supporting cross-platform deployment (Android, Windows). Python backend to benchmark and serve process information, either randomly generated or loaded from Server/processes.json.

projects.title: COOL Compiler
projects.description:
This project is a complete compiler for the Classroom Object-Oriented Language (COOL), implemented in Go. Features include: Full implementation of COOL language features like classes, inheritance, methods, and control structures. Robust lexical and syntax analysis with recursive descent and Pratt parsing. Semantic analysis for type checking and symbol table construction. LLVM IR generation with optimizations like constant propagation and dead code elimination. Support for importing modules and modular program organization.
Setup: Requires Go 1.23.4, LLVM toolchain, and Make. Clone the repository and run 'make all I=pathtocoolfile' to build and compile a COOL program.

projects.title: Symbolic Control for Nonlinear Systems
projects.description:
This project implements symbolic abstraction and control for nonlinear systems.
Features include: Symbolic abstraction of nonlinear systems. Synthesis of controllers for safety, reachability, and other specifications. Integration with system dynamics and parameters.

projects.title: PixelLMS
projects.description:
PixelLMS is a full-stack web-based learning management system developed as a software engineering project. It allows educators and students to manage courses, assignments, events, and discussions with role-based access.
Features include: Secure user authentication (SHA256/MD5 with Factory Pattern), assignment and event tracking, MVC architecture using Spring Boot (backend) and Vue.js (frontend), robust database operations with raw SQL, and agile Scrum-based development. Notable design patterns used include Factory, Strategy, and Command.

projects.title: Faceless channel AI video generator
projects.description: A tool that makes creating faceless social media videos easier than ever. It automatically grabs interesting posts from Reddit, turns them into natural-sounding speech, and perfectly syncs the audio with visuals. Then, it edits the video to match the slick, eye-catching style of Instagram’s 2022 trends. No complicated setups or tech skills needed—just plug in your content and get a ready-to-share video that stands out on any platform. This tool takes the hassle out of video creation so you can focus on sharing great stories.

projects.title: Online Bookstore (First Go Project + Learning Devops)
projects.description: This project implements a RESTful API for an online bookstore to manage books, authors, and sales reports. Features include: Authentication using UUID Bearer tokens. Book Management to add, update, retrieve, and delete books with filtering by title, author, or genre. Author Management to add, update, retrieve, and delete authors. Sales Reporting to generate daily sales reports with total revenue and top-selling books, saved as JSON files. Middlewares for token-based authentication, request logging, and context-based database access. Scalability with PostgreSQL, layered design, and graceful shutdown. Technologies Used: Go for the backend and PostgreSQL for data storage.

projects.title: Hamming code error correxion using RISC V assembly
projects.description: In this project, I focused on developing a Hamming code algorithm using RISC-V assembly language. My goal was to implement error detection and correction techniques, specifically targeting single-bit errors in data transmission. The project involved writing assembly code to generate the Hamming code, as well as verifying and correcting errors in received data. Through this implementation, I gained a deeper understanding of low-level programming, the structure of RISC-V assembly, and how error-correcting codes function to ensure data integrity in communication systems.

projects.title: Traffic Simulation and Modeling
projects.description: We developed a project to address the issues that some of our metropolises, were facing. We decided to look into the fields of traffic management in view of the major issues of traffic jams, accidents on the road, and poor road design. The primary goal of this project is to use Unity to develop a robust traffic simulation platform which focuses on realistic vehicle interactions, real-world road layouts, and the application of traffic laws.

projects.title: Airnest
projects.description: Welcome to our Flight Booking System! This platform streamlines the flight booking process, providing users with a convenient and user-friendly experience. The system includes secure transactions, comprehensive database management, and efficient installation procedures. This is a database management course final project.

projects.title: R2D2 Robot
projects.description: I have participated in the 2024th edition of the National Robotics Competition hosted annually by the EMINES E-tech club. My team and I developed within the 24-hour hackathon, an R2-D2 like robot, inspired by the Star Wars series. The robot had full rotational mobility, Bluetooth controls, ultrasound captors for obstacle detection, and a buzzer to signal close objects.

projects.title: Geoblox Dash
projects.description: Collaborated with 3D modeler @rogenus to develop an engaging game. Players collect orbs to enhance speed and trade them for in-game currency to purchase upgrades. Achieved a significant milestone of 1.7 million visits.

projects.title: Jacard recommendation system
projects.description: Developed a console application that simulates a Jaccard similarity-based video recommendation system. Utilized a custom dataset of videos and users to enhance algorithmic accuracy.

projects.title: Custom Language Mapper
projects.description: Designed a lexer to compile 'Darija' language code into Python using a proprietary syntax. Transformed 'Darija' scripts into equivalent Python code for seamless integration.

projects.title: Space disasters
projects.description: Designed a survival game set in space where players navigate natural disasters across various planets. Unlocked special effects and survived extreme conditions. Accumulated 1.6 million visits.

projects.title: Food Run
projects.description: Co-authored a game with @rogenus focused on health and fitness. Players race to maintain a healthy physique by avoiding junk food and participating in sports activities. Surpassed 5 million visits.

projects.title: Pillar and Moon Abilities game prototype
projects.description: Participated in a 4-hour coding challenge themed 'pillars and moon'. Developed specialized character abilities within the given timeframe.

projects.title: Mini Roleplay game
projects.description: Created a test roleplay game that garnered 693K visits, demonstrating initial success and engagement.

projects.title: ASYNC automod
projects.description: Developed an interactive Discord bot featuring currency collection, weapon acquisition, and attack mechanics. Included both auto-moderation and manual moderation support, with an intuitive, reaction-based configuration menu. Reached a milestone of 12,000 servers and 100,000 users. Although it's an older and more basic project, I keep it in my portfolio because it was one of my first large-scale achievements and an important milestone at that stage in my learning journey.

experiences.title: Blockchain Engineer Intern
experiences.company: UM6P College Of Computing + OCP Group
experiences.description: Developed a Blockchain-Enabled IoT ecosystem for the phosphate supply chain, supporting OCP Group's digital transformation goals. Utilized Hyperledger Fabric for secure, auditable transactions, Fabric CA for identity management, and CouchDB for JSON-based data storage. Deployed on Toubkal, Africa's most powerful supercomputer, using Apptainer for containerization and Slurm for task orchestration. Built backend with Node.js/Express.js for REST APIs and frontend with Next.js for role-based interfaces, improving transparency, traceability, and cybersecurity in Morocco's phosphate industry.

experiences.title: Data science Engineer
experiences.description: Created an AI Voice Agent for Building Information on Command for Upfund, enabling real estate professionals to access building data via voice requests on WhatsApp. Built a backend system and message processing pipeline using Retrieval-Augmented Generation technic (RAG), and FastAPI. Vectorized data and stored it in DuckDB, ensuring reliable data handling with a Pydantic-based validation pipeline. Designed a modular, scalable system to deliver accurate, real-time building information.

experiences.title: Software Engineering Intern
experiences.company: Ministry of Agriculture, Maritime Fisheries, Rural Development, and Water and Forests, Rabat
experiences.description: Developed a platform for supervisors to manage intern projects, including task creation, event planning, and progress tracking. Implemented security measures to protect the backend using Java Spring Boot, PG Admin, and PostgreSQL DBMS.

experiences.title: Research Competitions
experiences.description:
Securing LoRaWAN IoT Systems for Health Data Protection: Submitted a research paper to the 7th Youth Research Forum (YRF) 2024 (Qatar University) and the 2025 8th IEEE CiSt Congress. The paper focuses on security enhancements for LoRaWAN-based IoT infrastructures to protect sensitive health data against emerging cyber threats.
Critical Digital Literacy in the MENA Region: Submitted a research paper to the 6th YRF 2024 on improving stochastic reputation systems to combat fake news and enhance social media security.

experiences.title: Forgebots UM6P Chair
experiences.description: Contributed to the Forgebots UM6P Student club, focusing on advancing robotics and automation initiatives through collaborative projects, research and workshop at UM6P.

experiences.title: ACM UM6P Chapter
experiences.company: UM6P College Of Computing + UM6P SOLE
experiences.description: Served as Vice-Chair (Sep 2024 - Jun 2025) and Cybersecurity/CTF Track Lead (Sep 2025 - Jun 2026) for the ACM UM6P Chapter. Organized events (MNPC 2023 / MCPC 2025) and led cybersecurity teams.
